text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
When he returns in the evening, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs for the remaining three floors to his apartment.
However, on rainy days, he takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.

Why does he do this? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out why this man takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor on rainy days.
Let me break down the information given and see if I can come up with a logical explanation.
First, the man lives on the 10th floor.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
That makes sense because it's efficient—he doesn't have to climb up 10 flights of stairs each morning.
In the evening, when he returns, he takes the elevator up to the 7th floor and then walks up the remaining three floors to his apartment.
So, on a typical day, he's taking the elevator part of the way and then walking the rest.
But on rainy days, he changes his routine.
Instead of getting off at the 7th floor, he stays on the elevator all the way to the 10th floor.
Why would he do that? Let me think about the possible reasons.
Maybe it's about avoiding getting wet.
If it's raining, walking from the 7th floor to the 10th floor would mean walking up three flights, which are probably exterior stairs.
If those stairs are exposed to the rain, he might get wet or his clothes might get damp.
By taking the elevator all the way, he stays dry inside the elevator, which is enclosed, so he avoids the rain.
Another possibility is that he's trying to save time.
On rainy days, maybe the elevator is faster or more convenient because he doesn't have to walk up the stairs.
However, on normal days, he might prefer walking the stairs because it's quicker for just three floors.
But I think the main reason is related to the weather, not time.
Let me also consider other factors.
Perhaps the building's elevator policy changes on rainy days, but that seems less likely.
It's more about his personal preference to stay dry.
So, putting it all together, the man takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor on rainy days to avoid walking in the rain and getting wet.
It makes sense because he's trying to stay dry while commuting home.

</think>

The man takes the elevator all the way to the 10th floor on rainy days to avoid getting wet while walking up the stairs, which are likely exposed to the rain.
